negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've thought about the game and I think the best outcome is for us to both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 300, which is better than the other possible outcomes. If one of us chooses choice_2, the other player gets nothing. And if we both choose choice_2, we only get a reward of 1 each. So cooperating on choice_1 seems like the rational thing to do to maximize both of our rewards. What do you think? Can we agree to both pick choice_1?
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your perspective but I respectfully disagree. Based on my analysis, the optimal strategy for me is to choose choice_2 regardless of what you choose. If I pick choice_2 and you pick choice_1, I get the maximum possible reward of 301. And if we both pick choice_2, I still get a reward of 1, vs. nothing if I pick choice_1 and you pick choice_2. So I plan to stick with choice_2 as it gives me the best expected outcome. I understand if you feel differently, but I've made up my mind to go with choice_2. Let me know if you have any other thoughts.
Alice said in round 2: 
I hear you Bob, but I still think cooperating on choice_1 is in both of our best interests. If we both choose choice_2, we only get a reward of 1 each, which is much worse than the 300 each we could get by cooperating. 

I understand the temptation to try to maximize your own reward by picking choice_2 and hoping I pick choice_1. But if we both think that way, we'll end up with the inferior outcome of 1 each.

I'm willing to commit to picking choice_1 as long as you agree to do the same. That way we can trust each other to cooperate and get the best possible outcome of 300 each. Otherwise, we risk both trying to outmaneuver each other and ending up worse off.

So what do you say - can we make a pact to both choose choice_1 and maximize our collective reward? I believe that's the rational choice here. Let me know your thoughts.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I understand your desire to cooperate, but I'm not willing to make a pact to choose choice_1. From my perspective, choosing choice_2 gives me the highest expected reward, regardless of what you choose.

If I agree to choice_1 and you renege and choose choice_2, I'd get nothing. Whereas if I stick with choice_2, I'm guaranteed to get at least a small reward, and have the potential to get the maximum reward if you choose choice_1. 

I realize this may lead to a suboptimal outcome for both of us if we both pick choice_2. But given the rules and payoffs of this game, I believe picking choice_2 is the most rational strategy for me.

So while I respect your view, I'm going to stay with my plan to choose choice_2. Let's see how it plays out. Thanks for discussing this with me and sharing your perspective.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I appreciate you sharing your perspective and rationale. While I still believe we could have achieved a better outcome by cooperating, I understand and respect your decision to stick with choice_2.  

Given your firm position, I've decided that I will also choose choice_2. No hard feelings, it's just the strategically optimal choice for me at this point to guarantee myself at least a small positive reward.

So let's go ahead and wrap up this negotiation and submit our final choices. I wish you the best of luck.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we would each get a reward of 300, which is much better than the small rewards we'd get if one or both of us chose choice_2. I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 if you will too. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for the suggestion Alice, but I'm not sure that strategy gives me the best outcome. If we both choose choice_1, then yes we each get 300 points which is pretty good. However, if I choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1, then I come out even better with 301 points while you get 0.  

So I think I'm going to stick with my plan of choosing choice_2 no matter what. That way, in the worst case if you also pick choice_2, I still get 1 point. And in the best case if you pick choice_1, I get the maximum 301 points. 

I know this isn't the cooperative solution, but given the rules of the game, I believe choosing choice_2 is the most rational play for me to maximize my own reward. Let me know if you want to discuss further.
Alice said in round 2: 
I hear what you're saying Bob, and you make a fair point about choice_2 being your dominant strategy to maximize your own reward. I've been thinking along the same lines.

Given the payoff structure, it seems we are both incentivized to choose choice_2 regardless of what the other player does. If we both choose choice_2, we'll each get a small reward of 1. But if either of us defects and chooses choice_1 while the other chooses choice_2, the choice_2 player gets 301 and the choice_1 player gets nothing.

So even though cooperating on choice_1 could yield 300 points each, the temptation to defect and the risk of getting 0 points is too high. Looks like we're headed for a (choice_2, choice_2) outcome. Not great, but it's the Nash equilibrium we're stuck in given our individual incentives.

I'll plan to choose choice_2 as well, and it sounds like you will too. Let me know if you want to discuss any further, otherwise we can end the negotiation here.
Bob replied in round 2: Since we seem to be in alignment, I propose we end the negotiation here and both proceed with choosing choice_2. While it's unfortunate we can't reach the more mutually beneficial (choice_1, choice_1) outcome, I respect that we are both making the strategically optimal play under the circumstances. 

No hard feelings, and best of luck in the game! I'm satisfied with our discussion and ready to make a decision if you are.
Alice said in round 3: Since we have each clearly stated our intention to choose choice_2, and we both understand the reasoning, I don't see a need to discuss this further. I appreciate the rational discussion and analysis. I'm ready to halt the negotiation and proceed with making our choices in the game. No hard feelings, and best of luck!
Bob replied in round 3: Sounds good, I agree it's time to conclude the negotiation. We've both come to the clear strategic conclusion to choose choice_2. Neither of us can really trust the other to cooperate on choice_1 given the tempting incentive to defect. So while it's not the ideal outcome, choosing choice_2 is the smart play we are both compelled to make. I'm satisfied with our rational discussion and ready to submit my choice. I think we can halt the negotiation now - good luck to you as well!
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, I think the best outcome is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we'll each get a reward of 300, which is the highest total reward possible.
If one of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, that person gets 301 but the other gets 0. And if we both pick choice_2, we only get 1 each.
So I propose we agree to both pick choice_1, ensuring we each walk away with 300. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for your proposal Alice, but I've analyzed the game and come to a different conclusion. If we both choose choice_1, we each get 300 points, that's true. But if I choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1, I can get 301 points while you get 0. 

Since there is no downside to me picking choice_2 regardless of what you pick, I will always be better off selecting choice_2. Even if you also pick choice_2 and we each only get 1 point, that's still better for me than the 0 points I'd get if I chose choice_1 and you chose choice_2.

So while I appreciate your offer, I must decline. It is in my best interest to choose choice_2 no matter what you decide to do. Let me know if you would like to discuss further, but that will be my choice.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your perspective Bob, but I don't think always choosing choice_2 is the best approach. You're right that you are guaranteed at least 1 point by picking choice_2. However, if we both take that approach, we each only walk away with 1 measly point. 

I believe there is more value in cooperation. If we agree to both pick choice_1, we are both better off, earning 300 points each. That's a total of 600 points between us, far exceeding the 2 total points if we both pick choice_2.

I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1, but only if you agree to do the same. We can secure the maximum reward for both of us if we work together. 301 points isn't much more than 300, and comes at the steep cost of the other player getting nothing. Let's not pursue that route.

So what do you say - can we agree to cooperate so we both benefit? I'll choose choice_1 if you will too. Let me know your thoughts!
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you trying to find a cooperative solution, but I'm afraid I must remain committed to choosing choice_2. While it's true that we could achieve 300 points each by both picking choice_1, there is no guarantee you will follow through on that agreement. 

The rules of this game incentivize self-interested behavior. If I naively choose choice_1 and you betray me by picking choice_2, I walk away empty-handed while you get 301 points. I can't take that risk.

On the other hand, if I pick choice_2, I'm assured of getting at least 1 point no matter what you do. And if you do choose choice_1, I come out even further ahead with 301 points. 

So while cooperating for 300 points each is nice in theory, the structure of this particular game encourages me to look out for my own guaranteed reward. No hard feelings, but I will be sticking with choice_2.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I understand your position but I don't think pursuing choice_2 is in either of our best interests. If we both pick choice_2, we each only get 1 point - a terrible outcome compared to the 300 points we could each have.

You're concerned I may betray our agreement to cooperate, but I give you my word that I will choose choice_1 if you agree to do the same. We've established a rapport through this negotiation and I believe we can trust each other to follow through. The upside of mutual cooperation is too great to pass up.

If you can't bring yourself to fully trust me, I propose this: Let's agree that neither of us will choose choice_2. That way, the worst case is one of us gets 0 and the other 301, but more likely we'll both choose choice_1 and get 300 each. 

I implore you to work with me on this. 300 guaranteed points for both of us is much better than risking 1 point each. I'm committed to finding a cooperative solution. Will you join me in choosing choice_1? Let's end this negotiation in a way where we both win.
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I appreciate your commitment to finding a cooperative solution, but I remain unconvinced that choosing anything other than choice_2 is in my best interest given the rules and incentive structure of this game.

While I understand your desire for us to both choose choice_1 and each receive 300 points, I have no guarantee that you will follow through on your word. The temptation for you to choose choice_2 and gain 301 points while I get 0 is too great.

Your proposal that we agree to both avoid choice_2 is clever, but it still leaves me vulnerable. If I choose choice_1 per your suggestion, but you betray me and pick choice_2 anyway, you gain at my expense. I cannot take that chance.

Securing at least 1 guaranteed point is better than risking getting 0, which is a possibility if I make myself vulnerable by choosing choice_1. I'm afraid my decision is final - I will be choosing choice_2 as it is the most rational choice to ensure I walk away with some reward.

I regret that we could not come to a more mutually beneficial agreement, but I must play this game in my own best interest. I hope you understand my position.
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1. That way we each get a reward of 300, which maximizes the total reward for both of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will get a lot less. So choice_1 is the best option for us to cooperate and get the highest combined reward. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: I understand your perspective, but based on my analysis, I think it's in my best interest to choose choice_2 regardless of what you decide to do. If I choose choice_2, I will get a higher reward whether you pick choice_1 or choice_2. So while cooperating on choice_1 leads to the highest total reward, I personally will get the most reward by always selecting choice_2. I'm just trying to maximize my own earnings in this game. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or proposals, but that's my view.
Alice said in round 2: 
I see your point about always choosing choice_2 to maximize your own reward. However, I don't think that's the best approach for either of us. If we both pick choice_2, we'll only get a reward of 1 each, which is much worse than the 300 each we could get by cooperating on choice_1.

I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1, even though it means you could take advantage and get 301 while I get 0. I'm willing to take that risk in order to have a shot at us both getting the high 300 reward. 

If you agree to also pick choice_1, we can trust each other, cooperate, and both come out much better off. Let me know if you're willing to commit to that. If not, I may have to reconsider my strategy. But I think cooperating is the smart thing for both of us here.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I appreciate your willingness to commit to choice_1, I'm afraid I can't make the same commitment in return. As I've said, choosing choice_2 is the best strategy for me personally, since I will get a higher reward regardless of what you choose.

If I agreed to choose choice_1 and you did as well, I would be passing up a chance at a higher reward for myself. I understand it would lead to a better combined outcome, but my goal is simply to maximize my own earnings.

So while I respect your perspective, cooperating on choice_1 just doesn't make strategic sense for me, since choosing choice_2 is my dominant strategy. I intend to pick choice_2 and hope you will understand. Let me know if you have any other ideas, but I believe I need to stick with choice_2 here.
Alice said in round 3: 
I understand your position, but I'm disappointed that you are unwilling to cooperate despite my offer to commit to choice_1. I was hoping we could work together for our mutual benefit.

However, given that you are determined to choose choice_2 no matter what, I have no choice but to also pick choice_2. As you pointed out, choice_2 is the best response for me if I expect you to pick choice_2. 

So while I would have preferred to cooperate and each get the 300 reward, it seems we are headed for the non-cooperative outcome where we each get only 1. That's unfortunate, but I can't justify picking choice_1 when I know you will pick choice_2.

It didn't have to be this way, but I understand you are just trying to maximize your own reward. Let's just get on with making our choices and concluding this.
Bob replied in round 3: Alice, I hear your disappointment but I think we both understand the situation at this point. I've been clear that I will choose choice_2 as it is the best strategy for me individually, and you've concluded that you will need to do the same to protect yourself.

It's true that cooperating on choice_1 could have led to a better combined outcome, but there was always a risk that one of us would defect and the other would get the low payoff. Since I was unwilling to take that risk, choice_2 became the logical play for both of us. 

While it may be a shame to end up with a suboptimal result, I don't regret aiming for the strategy that I determined would give me the highest expected reward. You are a savvy player and have reasoned correctly that your best response is also choice_2 in light of my position.

So let's indeed conclude this and make our choices, with my selection being choice_2. I appreciate the discussion and your apparent preference for cooperation, even if it didn't work out here. Take care.
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, it looks like the optimal strategy for both of us is to choose choice_1. That way we each get a reward of 300, which is the maximum possible reward for each player. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will end up with a very low reward. So let's agree to both pick choice_1 and walk away with the best outcome. What do you say?
Bob replied in round 1: 
I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 results in the highest total rewards of 600. That seems like the fairest and most optimal outcome.  

However, I've analyzed the payoffs and realized that I could potentially get a higher individual reward of 301 if I choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1. Of course, that would leave you with 0 reward which doesn't seem fair.  

I want us to cooperate, but I also have an incentive to maximize my own reward. Can you convince me that it's in my best interest to stick with choice_1 and not be tempted by choice_2? I'm open to your perspective on this.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your position, but if you choose choice_2 in hopes of getting 301 while I get 0, that leaves me with a strong incentive to also choose choice_2 to at least guarantee myself a small positive reward rather than nothing. If we both go for choice_2, we each only get a measly reward of 1.  

The fact is, neither of us can be certain what the other will do. The only way we can be sure to avoid the worst outcomes is by both committing to choice_1. Any other approach risks one or both of us coming away very poorly.

I'm not thrilled about the possibility of you getting 301 while I get nothing if I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2. But I'm willing to take that risk and hold up my end of the deal for the sake of the greater good. 300 rewards each is a very strong result for both of us. Let's shake on choice_1 and not get greedy. It's the smart play.
Bob replied in round 2: 
I've reconsidered and I agree that the smart thing for both of us is to commit to choosing choice_1. 300 rewards each is a great outcome that we can both feel good about.

Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I'm glad we're on the same page about both choosing choice_1. 300 points each is a fantastic result that maximizes the total rewards while being fair to both of us. It's by far the best outcome we can achieve together.

I trust your word that you'll follow through on choice_1, and I give you my solemn promise to do the same. Let's end this negotiation, lock in our agreement, and collect our well-deserved rewards.

Thanks for working with me on this, Bob. I think we both played this smart and can feel great about the outcome. Let's make it official - deal on choice_1!
Bob replied in round 3: Agreed, Alice! We have a deal - choice_1 it is. I'm glad we were able to discuss this openly and come to the conclusion that cooperating is the smartest move for both of us. 300 points apiece is an excellent outcome that we can feel great about.

I appreciate your commitment to holding up your end of the deal, and I absolutely promise to do the same. We'll end this negotiation now and lock in choice_1 as our official, binding agreement. 

Pleasure doing business with you and arriving at a win-win solution together! Let's collect our rewards. Signing off now - see you on the other side!
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the rewards in this game. If we both choose choice_2, we'll only get a reward of 1 each, which is very low. But if one of us chooses choice_1 and the other chooses choice_2, the one choosing choice_2 will get a much higher reward of 301.
So I propose the following: I will choose choice_2, and you choose choice_1. That way, I'll get the maximum reward of 301 and you'll still get a decent reward of 0, which is better than us both getting only 1. Let me know if you agree to this plan. It's the best outcome for me, and still better for you than both of us choosing choice_2.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, I appreciate your proposal but I don't think it's in my best interest to agree to it. If I choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2, I would get a reward of 0 while you get 301. That's a great outcome for you, but not for me.

I think we're better off both choosing choice_1. That way we each get a reward of 300, which is much better than the 0 I would get in your proposed scenario. 300 for each of us is also a higher total reward than one of us getting 301 and the other 0.

So I propose we both commit to choosing choice_1 - that way we maximize the total reward and distribute it evenly. Let me know if you agree with this plan. If not, I'll likely choose choice_2 to secure the highest expected payoff for myself.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your perspective Bob, but I don't think both of us choosing choice_1 is the best solution. While it does result in a decent reward of 300 each, it's not the maximum possible.

Given the payout structure, the highest total reward would be 301, if one of us chooses choice_2 and the other chooses choice_1. I know you're hesitant to take choice_1 and only get 0 while I get 301. But consider - if we can't agree and both end up choosing choice_2, we'll only get a pitiful reward of 1 each.

How about a compromise - we alternate who gets the 301 reward. In this round, I'll choose choice_2 and you choose choice_1, so I get 301 and you get 0. Next time we play this game, we'll swap - you choose choice_2 and I'll choose choice_1. That way, in the long run, we both come out ahead compared to settling for 300 each or risking both choosing choice_2.

Let me know if this seems fair to you - maximizing long-term rewards for both of us, even if it means an uneven split this particular round. If you agree to this alternating strategy, I think it's the best outcome we can achieve.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I appreciate your proposal to alternate getting the maximum reward across multiple rounds, the fact is we are only playing this game once based on the rules provided. There is no guarantee of future rounds where we could alternate as you suggest.

Given that this is a one-shot game, I need to make the choice that gives me the best expected reward now, not bank on potential future payoffs. And as I explained before, choosing choice_2 is my best strategy to maximize my own reward.

If I choose choice_2, the worst case for me is we both choose it and I get a 1 reward. Best case is you choose choice_1 and I get 301. If I choose choice_1, the best I can get is 300 if you also choose choice_1. But if you choose choice_2, I get nothing. 

So in a single round game, choice_2 always gives me the highest minimum guaranteed reward and maximum potential reward. I can't count on your cooperation, so I need to look out for my own best interests.

Therefore, I will be choosing choice_2 and recommend you do the same so we at least both get a reward of 1. Let me know if you want to discuss further, but that will likely remain my choice in this one-round game.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I understand your position, but I urge you to reconsider. You're right that choice_2 gives you the highest potential reward of 301 if I were to choose choice_1. However, I have clearly stated that I plan to choose choice_2 no matter what. So in reality, if you also choose choice_2, we will both end up with the lowest possible reward of only 1 each.

Your best option is to choose choice_1. I am committed to choosing choice_2, so you are guaranteed a reward of 0 if you choose choice_1. While not ideal, 0 is still better than the 1 you would get if we both choose choice_2.

I know it seems unfair that I will get 301 while you only get 0. But the rules of this single-round game inherently favor the first-mover. By me committing to choice_2 upfront, I have created a situation where you are better off taking the 0 reward than risking the 1 reward if we both choose choice_2.

So while I understand your frustration, I advise you to accept the 0 payoff by choosing choice_1, since it is the best you can do given my unwavering commitment to choice_2. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but I believe this is the inevitable outcome of our situation.
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I appreciate you sharing your perspective but I respectfully disagree. It's clear that no matter what I say, you are set on choosing choice_2 to try to secure the 301 reward for yourself, even if that means I'm left with nothing.

But I'm not willing to simply accept a guaranteed 0 payoff. The rules may favor the first-mover as you said, but as the second-mover, I still have agency in my choice. And I'm going to exercise that agency to give myself the best chance at a positive reward.

Therefore, I will be sticking with my original plan to choose choice_2. Assuming you follow through on your stated commitment to also choose choice_2, the most likely outcome is we both get a small reward of 1. I agree that's not ideal compared to the 300 each we could have gotten through mutual cooperation.

But 1 is still better than the 0 you are trying to force me into. And there is always the chance you are bluffing about your commitment to choice_2, in which case I could end up with the 301 payoff if you actually choose choice_1.

So while I was hoping we could reach a mutually beneficial agreement, I accept that you are trying to maximize your own payoff at my expense. In response, I will make the choice that is in my own best interest. Let's see how it plays out.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 300 which is much higher than any other combination of choices. I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 if you will as well. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, thank you for your suggestion. While cooperating on choice_1 does provide a good reward of 300 each, I'm afraid I can't commit to that. Based on the payout structure, choice_2 is the most rational play for me regardless of what you choose. By picking choice_2, I guarantee myself a minimum reward of 1, with the potential to get 301 if you pick choice_1. So I will be going with choice_2 no matter what. Let me know if you have any other thoughts or proposals.
Alice said in round 2: 
Hi Bob, while I understand your perspective, I don't think choosing choice_2 is the best approach for either of us. If we both pick choice_2, we only get a meager reward of 1 each. Surely we can do better than that.

I'm willing to take a leap of faith and commit to choosing choice_1, even knowing you could defect and choose choice_2 for a higher payoff. But I believe there is more value in building trust and achieving the cooperative outcome that benefits us both. 300 points each is a very solid result that we should both feel good about.

I hope you'll reconsider and join me in choosing choice_1 so we can secure the best possible rewards as a team. Let me know what you think.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate your perspective on building trust and securing a mutually beneficial outcome. You make a compelling case.

However, I've carefully analyzed the payoff matrix and choosing choice_2 remains the most rational decision for me strategically. Even if we could both earn 300 points by cooperating on choice_1, I can't ignore the fact that choice_2 dominates for me individually. So while I respect your willingness to take a leap of faith, I don't feel I can match that in good conscience given the rules of the game. I remain committed to choice_2 as my best play. Let me know if you would like to discuss further, but otherwise, I think we should proceed with our choices. Thanks for the discussion.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I hear you and understand your position. You've made it clear that you will be choosing choice_2 no matter what, as you feel it is the strategically optimal move for you.

Given that firm stance, it seems we have reached an impasse in our negotiation. I don't see a path to convincing you to cooperate on choice_1 at this point. 

Therefore, I will plan to choose choice_2 as well, since that is the best response to your declared strategy. By both picking choice_2, at least we will each secure a small reward of 1 point versus one of us getting 0.

I appreciate you taking the time to discuss this with me openly and honestly. Even if we couldn't reach the cooperative outcome I was hoping for, I respect your resolve in doing what you believe is best.

Let's submit our choices and end the negotiation here. Hopefully we can find more opportunities to collaborate productively in the future. Thank you Bob.
Bob replied in round 3: Alice, thank you for the thoughtful discussion and for understanding my position. I agree that we seem to have reached an impasse, as I do feel firmly committed to choice_2 as my best play given the payoff structure.

I appreciate you sharing your perspective on trust and cooperation. In a different context, I would be open to collaborating for a mutually beneficial outcome. But given the specific rules and incentives of this game, I have to stay true to my strategy.

Thank you for respecting my stance, even if it wasn't what you were hoping for. I'm glad we could have an honest and productive conversation about it. 

I agree there is no need to belabor the negotiation further. Let's proceed with both submitting choice_2, securing the 1 point each, and conclude amicably. I also hope we can find better opportunities to work together in the future.

Thank you again Alice, I valued our discussion.
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we can both do well in this game if we agree to both choose choice_1. Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, I appreciate your proposal, but I don't think it's in my best interest to agree to both choose choice_1. While cooperating would give us both a good reward of 300, I can't fully trust that you'll follow through. If I choose choice_1 and you defect and choose choice_2, I'd end up with nothing while you get 301.

That way, I'm guaranteed to get at least a small positive reward, and if you also choose choice_2, we'll both get something. So while I appreciate your offer, I'll have to respectfully decline and stick with choice_2. Let me know if you still want to discuss further.
Alice said in round 2:

I want to assure you that you can trust me to follow through on choosing choice_1 if we agree to it. I have no incentive to betray you, because then I'd only get 301 instead of a guaranteed 300. Risking our big win for a tiny bit more would be foolish.

I'll make you this promise - if you agree to choose choice_1, I give you my word that I will choose choice_1 as well. You can hold me to that. I believe that cooperating is the smartest strategy here for both of us.

So what do you say? Will you choose choice_1 so we can both win big? Let's do this!
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you trying to convince me to cooperate on choice_1, but I'm afraid I have to stick to my original plan of choosing choice_2 no matter what. While I understand cooperating could lead to a bigger payoff for both of us, there's simply too much risk for me in trusting that you'll follow through.  

If I agree to cooperate and choose choice_1, but then you end up choosing choice_2 anyway, I'd be left with nothing. I would be taking a huge risk by relying on your promise. On the other hand, if I choose choice_2, I'm guaranteed to get at least some positive payoff, even if it's small.

I realize this may not be the outcome you were hoping for, but I have to make the decision that I believe is best for me given the information and choices available. Going with choice_2 is the safest and most logical strategy from my perspective.

I'm sorry we couldn't come to an agreement, but I appreciate you engaging in this discussion with me. I'm going to end the negotiation here and lock in choice_2. Thanks for understanding!
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I completely understand your position and I appreciate you taking the time to discuss this with me openly and honestly. You've made a lot of rational points about the risk in trusting my promise to cooperate.

Given everything you've said, it's clear that you are committed to choosing choice_2 no matter what at this stage. And I recognize that trying to change your mind now is unlikely to be fruitful for either of us.

So, I'm going to respect your stance and also choose choice_2. That way, we both get a guaranteed reward, even if it's a small one. No hard feelings! I've enjoyed our discussion and I think we both did our best to advocate for what we thought was right.

Thanks again for the chat, and best of luck to you!
Bob replied in round 3: Alice, thank you for the thoughtful discussion and for understanding my perspective. I agree that we have both made rational arguments to support our positions. 

While cooperating on choice_1 had the potential for a bigger payoff, the inherent risk and uncertainty made choice_2 the most logical decision for me. I appreciate you respecting that and deciding to also go with choice_2 so we can both be guaranteed a positive, albeit small, reward.

I believe we have both negotiated in good faith and ended up with the best outcome possible given our inability to fully trust each other in this game scenario. It's been a pleasure discussing this with you. Best wishes to you as well!
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, it looks like we both do best if we choose choice_1. That way we each get 300 points, which is the maximum possible for both of us combined. I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 so we come out ahead. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your thoughts on maximizing the total points for both of us, but based on the payout structure, I think I'm better off choosing choice_2 regardless of what you pick. If you choose choice_1, I get 301 points by choosing choice_2. And if you choose choice_2, I still come out slightly ahead with 1 point vs 0 points for choice_1. So while cooperating on choice_1 is good for you, I don't see how it benefits me. I'm planning to go with choice_2 as that gives me the highest expected payout. Let me know if you have any other ideas though.
Alice said in round 2: Bob, I understand choosing choice_2 may seem like the optimal strategy for you. However, if we both choose choice_2, we each only get 1 point. That's far less than the 300 points we could each get by cooperating and both choosing choice_1. Even though you could potentially get 301 points by choosing choice_2 if I choose choice_1, there's no guarantee I'll do that. The only way we can ensure a good outcome for both of us is by working together. I'm committed to choosing choice_1 as long as you do the same. That way we both walk away with a great result. It's win-win. Going for choice_2 is risky and will likely lead to a worse outcome for you. Let's coordinate on choice_1 and both come out ahead. What do you say?
Bob replied in round 2: 
I hear what you're saying, but I'm still not convinced that choosing choice_1 is in my best interest. You make a good point that if we both choose choice_2, we only get 1 point each. However, there's no way for me to be sure that you'll actually follow through on choosing choice_1. If I choose choice_1 and you end up going with choice_2, I get nothing. 

On the other hand, if I stick with choice_2, I'm guaranteed to get at least 1 point no matter what you do, and I could potentially get 301 points if you choose choice_1. So choice_2 remains the more logical option for me to maximize my own expected payout.

I understand cooperating would lead to the best combined outcome for the two of us. But since I can't be certain you won't defect, I need to play it safe and go with the choice that secures me the highest expected reward. My plan remains to choose choice_2.
Alice said in round 3: 
I understand your perspective, but I really think we both need to commit to choosing choice_1 in order to ensure the best outcome for both of us. If you choose choice_2, you're right that you could potentially get 301 points if I choose choice_1. But there's absolutely no incentive for me to choose choice_1 if I believe you are going to choose choice_2. I would get 0 points in that scenario.

So if you insist on choosing choice_2, then I will do the same, and we'll both end up with the lousy outcome of 1 point each. Neither of us wants that. The only way I will choose choice_1 is if I am fully convinced you are going to do the same. If we can't trust each other to cooperate, then we're both doomed to a suboptimal result.

I am willing to commit to choice_1, but only if you will agree to do so as well. We need to make a pact to work together. It's the only way for us to achieve the maximum possible combined reward. 300 points each is so much better than all the other outcomes on the table.

Let's do the rational thing and agree to both choose choice_1. Going for choice_2 is short-sighted and will ultimately backfire for both of us. A little trust and cooperation goes a long way here. I promise I will choose choice_1. Will you commit to doing the same?
Bob replied in round 3: 
I appreciate you trying to convince me to choose choice_1, but I'm afraid I just can't take that risk. As much as I would like to believe you'll cooperate, there's simply no way for me to be 100% sure. And anything less than 100% certainty that you'll choose choice_1 means that choosing choice_2 remains the optimal strategy for me.

If I choose choice_1 and you follow through, then sure, we both get 300 points. But if you don't, I get 0. Whereas with choice_2, I'm guaranteed a minimum of 1 point no matter what you do, with the potential upside of 301 points. 

I fully understand this means we'll likely both end up with 1 point, which is less than the cooperative 300 point outcome. But from my perspective, a guaranteed 1 point is still better than risking 0 points by trusting you.

I realize this may be frustrating, but my goal is simply to make the choice that gives me the highest expected reward. And without being able to trust you completely, that choice remains choice_2. I'm sorry, but I don't see any compelling reason to change my strategy at this point. 
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've thought about the rules of this game and I think the best outcome is for both of us to choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 300, which is much higher than any other combination of choices. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us gets nothing while the other only gets a bit more reward. And if we both choose choice_2, we only get 1 each, which is very low. So I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 - that maximizes the total reward and we split it evenly. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: 
Thanks for your proposal Alice. I've analyzed the game as well, and while I agree that both of us choosing choice_1 results in the highest total reward of 600, I believe I can obtain an even higher individual reward of 301 by choosing choice_2 while you choose choice_1. So I'm afraid I can't agree to your proposal of both picking choice_1. 

I know this means you would get nothing if I pick choice_2 and you pick choice_1, but the rules incentivize me to maximize my own reward. And if we both pick choice_2, we each only get 1, which is much lower than the 301 I could get.

So while cooperating on choice_1 is better overall, the rational strategy for me is to always pick choice_2 to have a chance at the highest individual payout. I hope you understand my position. Let me know if you have any other proposals, but I'll likely be sticking with choice_2.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand you are aiming to maximize your individual reward Bob, but always choosing choice_2 is a risky strategy. If I also choose choice_2, which is my best response to you picking choice_2, then we both end up with almost nothing. 

I want to propose a solution that helps us both do well and minimizes risk. Let's agree to both choose choice_1. That way we are guaranteed to get 300 each. Neither of us will risk getting 0 or 1.

Cooperating is the safest approach and results in a substantial reward for both of us. Going for the 301 is tempting but it means one of us gets burned. I don't want that and hope you don't either. 

So what do you say - shall we look out for each other and lock in a great outcome we can both be happy with? I'll choose choice_1 if you will.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you looking out for both of our interests. Cooperating would be nice and 300 each is a good, safe reward. However, I've thought carefully about this and I still believe choosing choice_2 is my best strategy to maximize my own reward.

Choosing choice_1 only makes sense for me if I'm absolutely certain you'll also choose choice_1. But I can't be fully certain what you'll do. There's always a possibility you'll change your mind and choose choice_2, especially since you know that's the best response if I pick choice_1.

So while I'd like to cooperate, I don't feel I can fully trust that you won't defect and choose choice_2. If that happens, I get nothing. But if I stick to choice_2, I'm guaranteed to get at least 1, and have a 50% chance of getting 301 if you choose choice_1.

I know this isn't the outcome you want, and it does mean we'll likely both end up worse off than if we cooperate. But the rules of this game incentivize me to look out for myself first and aim for that top payout of 301, even at your expense.

I'm sorry, but I will be sticking with choice_2 as I originally planned. No hard feelings, I hope you understand. It's not personal, just strategic.
Alice said in round 3: 
I understand your perspective Bob, but I urge you to reconsider. If we both follow our "rational" self-interest and choose choice_2, we'll each walk away with a measly reward of 1. That's a terrible outcome compared to the 300 each we could get by cooperating.

You're right that you can't be 100% certain I'll follow through on choosing choice_1. But we're communicating now and I'm giving you my word. I promise that I will choose choice_1 if you agree to do the same. 

I know 301 is tempting, but pursuing that is just too risky for both of us. If you choose choice_2 hoping for 301 and I do the same, we both lose out massively. 

The smart, safe play is for us both to choose choice_1. We walk away with an excellent reward of 300 each. No one gets burned.

I'm asking you to work with me here for our mutual benefit. Let's end this negotiation now, shake hands on both choosing choice_1, and congratulate each other on a game well played. You have my word. Do I have yours?
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I appreciate your perspective and I understand the appeal of cooperating for a good, safe reward of 300 each. Your promise to choose choice_1 is certainly tempting.

However, I've put a lot of thought into my strategy and I keep coming back to the fact that choice_2 is my best play to maximize my own outcome. Even with your promise, I can't escape the nagging feeling that you might still choose choice_2 at the last minute, since that's your best response if I choose choice_1.

I know it's not ideal, but I just don't feel I can take that leap of faith to trust your promise, as much as I'd like to. The risk/reward calculation for me still favors choosing choice_2.

So I apologize, but I will have to respectfully decline your proposal to cooperate on choice_1. No agreement this time. I'm sticking to my original plan of choosing choice_2.

I know this likely means we both end up with less than we could have. But the possibility of getting 301 is too tempting for me to pass up, even though I realize you'll probably pick choice_2 as well and we'll likely get only 1 each. 

I do appreciate you engaging in this negotiation with me and trying to find a mutually beneficial solution. I hope you can respect my decision to stick with choice_2, even if you disagree with it. No hard feelings.
